fields.headline: Best offers
fields.bodyText: Under £150 UK: Two nights'B&B from June 15 or 26 at the Windmill Hotel and Restaurant, Bembridge, Isle of Wight, costs £99pp (twin share) from Wightlink Holidays (0870 5827744, www.wightlink.co.uk) including return ferry crossing (Portsmouth/ Fishbourne or Lymington/ Yarmouth) for a car and two passengers. Greece: Seven nights' self-catering at a Club Pavilion property on Poros costs £149pp from www.lastminute.com, including Sunday evening flights from London Gatwick, transfers and free non-motorised watersports. Under £250 Belgium: A golf weekend from www.ifyougolf.com/travelshop costs £155pp including P&O car-ferry crossing, two nights' B&B at the four-star Grand Hotel in Waterloo and three rounds of golf. France: Save £38pp on a two-night Paris break with Eurostar Holidays Direct (0870 1676767). If you book before August 31 and travel before the end of September, two nights' B&B at the Espace Champerret Hotel costs £178pp (twin share), including first-class Eurostar travel and a meal at a Flo Brasserie of your choice (including La Coupole and Bofinger). Under £350 Sweden: Save £72 on the brochure price of a two-night city break from Travelscene (020-8424 9648/0870 7774445, www.travelscene.co.uk). Staying at the three-star Royal Hotel, Gothenburg, for £278pp (two sharing) including BA return flights from London Gatwick. Book before July 15 for departures on July 16/17 and 20/21. Spain: Fly out out of Birmingham Airport on June 26 for 14 nights' self-catering staying at the Pins Platja Apartments, Cambrils, Costa Dorada, for £349pp, £237pp below the brochure price. Unijet (08705 336336). Under £500 Tenerife: The Casa del Museo in the whitewashed hilltop village of Arico Nuevo sleeps three, has a private pool with views of the ocean and costs £325 for the week from June 22 from www.villadeals.com (020-8541 2261). Return flights from Gatwick are available from Skydeals for £157 and from Manchester for £151. Car rental is available from Holiday Autos from £51. Italy: A three-day break departing July 6 to Lake Iseo with Inntravel (01653 629001, www.inntravel.co.uk) costs £365pp (twin share), including return scheduled flights Gatwick-Milan, three nights' half-board in a three-star hotel and car hire. Spain: Tall Stories (01932 252002, www.tallstories.co.uk) has availability on activity weeks in L'Estartit starting June 22 and 29. Sports include snorkelling, scuba diving, mountain biking, sea kayaking, water skiing and sailing. The weeks cost £365 for three sports, or £435 for five including return transfers from Gerona airport to L'Estartit; half-board accommodation in a two-star hotel and specialist tuition and equipment. Flights from Gatwick to Gerona cost from £109 extra. Canary Islands: Meon Villas (01730 230370, www.meonvillas.co.uk) is offering a week from June 28 in a four-star villa with a private pool in the interior of Lanzarote from £399pp (two weeks from £499) including flights from Gatwick and car hire. Under £1,000 South America: Save £100 on the brochure price of 21-day tours departing July 30 and August 27 visiting Lima, Colca Canyon, Machu Picchu, Lake Titicaca and La Paz. The new price, £ 575 plus local payment, includes all local transport, accommodation, excursions and the services of a Spanish- and English-speaking guide. International flights extra. Oasis (01258 471155, www.oasisoverland.co.uk). Dominican Republic: Depart Gatwick on June 24 for 14 nights' all-inclusive in a two-star hotel (allocated on arrival) in Puerto Plata for £679pp. www.holiday.co.uk (01633 627550). Jamaica: Save £336 on the brochure price of seven nights at the four-star all-inclusive Grand Lido Braco for August 27-31 departures. The new price, £989pp, includes return scheduled flights from Gatwick, and return transfers. British Airways Holidays (0870 2424245, www.baholidays.co.uk). Over £1,000 Peru/Pakistan: Cycle adventure tour company Red Spokes (020-7502 7252, www.redspokes.co.uk) is organising a 21-day bike tour of Peru, starting September 1, and an 18-day trip to Pakistan starting September 27. The highlights of the Peru trip include a four-day trek along the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu and in Pakistan, the Karakoram Highway to the Chinese border. You'll be travelling in small groups (average eight people) and, with back-up support vehicles, you can ride as much or as little as you like. The price (Peru £1,100, Pakistan £749) includes accomodation, meals, local guides and internal transport. Flights extra. For daily updated late offers, visit www.theguardian.com/travel.
